**Necrotise** is a level 1 [Necromancy](/Necromancy "Necromancy") spell which fires a beam of [negative energy](/Negative_energy "Negative energy") against a single target; it must succeed against the enemy's [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") to function. If it kills the target, or the target is killed within 1.0 turn after, it creates a [skeleton](/Skeleton "Skeleton") ally.

[Necromancers](/Necromancer "Necromancer") begin with this spell in their libraries. [Kikubaaqudgha](/Kikubaaqudgha "Kikubaaqudgha") can gift this spell at 1\* of piety.

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 Monster Spell](#Monster_Spell)
- [4 History](#History)

## Useful Info

Other than dealing direct damage, this spell creates [derived undead](/Derived_undead "Derived undead"), in the form of skeletons.

[HD](/HD "HD") of skeletons depends on the [spellpower](/Spellpower "Spellpower"): `minion_hd = mons_hd * (100 + pow) / 300`. This means that at the max spellpower skeletons will have 1/2 of their original HD. Skeletons will last for around 27 turns, regardless of spellpower. There is no limit to the amount of skeletons that you can create.

Necrotise has an [enchantment power](/Enchantment_power "Enchantment power") multiplier of x3.5, which makes it significantly harder to resist than other early-game spells. However, due to the low *spell power* cap, it struggles to affect enemies in the mid-game onwards.

## Strategy

Necrotise deals decent damage that ignores [AC](/AC "AC") and [EV](/EV "EV"). For an XL 1 [Necromancer](/Necromancer "Necromancer"), expect around a 60-80% chance for Necrotise to work (ignoring your own [spell failure](/Spell_failure "Spell failure") rate).

Note that your own skeletons can block Necrotise's line of fire.

## Monster Spell

Monsters have access to the [Pain](/Pain "Pain") spell, which deals the same damage but doesn't create a skeleton.

## History

- Removed in [0.32](/0.32 "0.32") and replaced by [Soul Splinter](/Soul_Splinter "Soul Splinter").
- Necrotise was introduced in [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), combining the effect of [Pain](/Pain "Pain") (without the self damage) and [Animate Skeleton](/Animate_Skeleton "Animate Skeleton").
